description.header: A vibrant workplace to build your business
description.content:
This former industrial space has become the home of flexible working in Toronto. 1655 Dupont Street is part of a unique reinvention of an eye-catching industrial space – a warehouse transformed into offices, with its silo now a striking architectural feature. From its position in the heart of the vibrant Junction Triangle neighbourhood of Toronto, this dynamic workspace is giving Ontario professionals a creative environment from which to work and meet like-minded professionals. Wellconnected to local transport and filled with a curated suite of offices, conference rooms and shared lounges, this hub promotes a dynamic alternative to traditional workspaces.
Across three floors of this reclaimed commercial building, you can tap into super-fast Wi-Fi friendly admin support staff ensure everything runs smoothly. The ground floor entrance opens into a shared space, adjacent to an artisan coffee shop – your first stop for your morning caffeine fix. If you’re looking for something different, head out to Bloor St. and visit nearby 2nd Nature Bakery and Cafe or Rancho Relaxo To Go Mexican restaurant, both popular local eateries. Bloor GO Train Station is a 15-minute walk away, ready to whisk you into the centre of Toronto. Additionally, there are buses departing regularly from a pair of stops just outside the centre. This area also boasts an inspirational cultural scene, with the Museum of Contemporary Art and Aluna Performing Arts Theatre both just a few blocks away.

description.header: An inspiring environment to do your best work
description.content:
Rated one of the coolest neighborhoods in the world by Vogue Magazine, Queen Street West is Toronto's artistic hub of urban pop culture and the home of this creative workspace. Contemporary and sophisticated, Spaces 180 John Street fuels innovative thinking in an inspiring and collaborative work environment. It's the perfect place to create a unique identity in Toronto's most in-demand market alongside tech powerhouses like Twitter and EBay.
Housed in a eight-storey brick and beam retail office building on the iconic John Street corridor, our modern workspace is formerly the home of one of the city's most treasured businesses, Urbane Cyclist. With its new persona, ambitious professionals can tap into the historic culture and artistic energy John Street exudes. Start your day with coffee on the rooftop patio. Take a break and peruse hundreds of art galleries nearby. Enjoy the ambiance and cuisine at acclaimed restaurants and eclectic cafes all steps away along the top retail and entertainment strip in downtown.
